name: volume-resample
author: Washington University School of Medicin
description:
TRANSFORM AND RESAMPLE A VOLUME FILE.

Resample a volume file with an arbitrary list of transformations.  You may specify -affine, -warp, and -affine-series multiple times each, and they will be used in the order specified.  For instance, for rigid motion correction followed by nonlinear atlas registration, specify -affine-series first, then -warp.  The recommended methods are CUBIC (cubic spline) for most data, and ENCLOSING_VOXEL for label data.  The parameter <method> must be one of:

CUBIC
ENCLOSING_VOXEL
TRILINEAR

inputs.name: volume_space
inputs.description: a volume file in the volume space you want for the output

inputs.name: opt_affine_affine
inputs.description: add an affine transform: the affine file to use

inputs.name: opt_affine_series_affine_series
inputs.description: add an independent affine per-frame: text file containing 12 or 16 numbers per line, each being a row-major flattened affine

inputs.name: opt_warp_warpfield
inputs.description: add a nonlinear warpfield transform: the warpfield file
